text: Jack Muratori (1929 – May 20, 2001) was a Republican Party lawmaker from Queens, New York who represented a Queens, At-Large New York City Council district from 1974 to 1983. He also served as Minority Leader in 1983.http://www.ourcampaigns.com/CandidateDetail.html?CandidateID=45154 Muratori, Jack After leaving politics he served as an executive of the King Kullen supermarket chain. Muratori died of cancer on May 20, 2001 at the age of 72. At the time of his death he had been residing in both Flushing, Queens and Point Lookout, Long Island with his wife Rosemary. Along with his wife Rosemary he left behind three sons.http://www.qgazette.com/news/2001-05-30/Political_Page/p01.html Feuding Starts As Mayoral Campaign Gets Ugly == References == Category:1929 births Category:2001 deaths Category:Deaths from cancer in New York (state) Category:American businesspeople in retailing Category:American grocers Category:New York City Council members Category:New York (state) Republicans Category:People from Point Lookout, New York Category:People from Queens, New York Category:20th-century American politicians
title: Jack Muratori
